snippet: State authorities declared another power alert today and asked residents and businesses to conserve energy because a heat wave has led to higher than anticipated demand.    The California Independent System Operator, which supplies power to about ...
lead_paragraph: State authorities declared another power alert today and asked residents and businesses to conserve energy because a heat wave has led to higher than anticipated demand. The California Independent System Operator, which supplies power to about 75 percent of the state, declared a ''Stage 2 Emergency,'' which means the system is using about 95 percent of its power and has 5 percent or less in reserve.
abstract: California authorities declare another power alert and ask residents and businesses to conserve energy because heat wave has led to higher than anticipated demand (S)

headline.main: National News Briefs; Californians Are Asked To Reduce Power Use
